sentence.Network_en: The tocsin rang impatiently, but other help ( if that were any ) there was none.
sentence.Network_cn: 警钟紧急地敲着, 却没有别的救援出现 ( 即使有,也没有来 ).

sentence.Network_en: The illuminated village had seized hold of the tocsin andabolishing the lawful ringer, rang for joy.
sentence.Network_cn: 火光照耀的村子已夺走了警钟, 赶走了法定敲钟人,自己欢乐地敲了起来.

PerfectNetExp.abs: toddler中文 ... Preschool stage 学龄前期 ... tocsin 警戒信号 toddler 幼童.
GRE逆序_馆档网 ... chagrin 失望，懊恼 tocsin 警钟（的声音），警报 raisin 葡萄干.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent.: from Old French toquassen, from Provençal tocasenh, from tocar 'to touch' + senh 'signal bell'

means.word_mean: 1. the sound of an alarm (usually a bell)
2. a bell used to sound an alarm
